title: Watch Ellie Goulding Perform Haunting Acoustic Cover of Anyma Collaboration, "Hypnotized"
description: With just a piano and her voice, Goulding transforms "Hypnotized" from a techno anthem into a quavering ballad.
author: Jason Heffler
excerpt: With just a piano and her voice, Goulding transforms "Hypnotized" from a techno anthem into a quavering ballad.
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists

html:
With just a piano and her voice, Goulding transforms "Hypnotized" from a techno anthem into a quavering ballad.

c/o Anyma

With just a piano and her voice, Goulding transforms "Hypnotized" from a techno anthem into a quavering ballad.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

Some songs are built for the dancefloor, others for the quiet corners of the soul. Ellie Goulding's acoustic rendition of "Hypnotized," her collaboration with Anyma, bridges both worlds with astounding clarity.

"Hypnotized" released after its viral premiere during the DJ's historic Vegas Sphere residency. Goulding performed the melodic techno track live as a stunning visual engulfed the crowd, her face contorting while a swarm of otherworldly hands clawed and twisted her features.

Her stripped-back take strips away the pulsing beats of the original, leaving behind a raw, intimate ballad that showcases her vocal prowess in its purest form. Accompanied only by a delicate piano, Goulding's voice is both soft and searing, floating effortlessly between breathy vulnerability and crystalline power.

The absence of Anyma's electronic production magnifies the cover's emotional weight, revealing a deep melancholy beneath the hypnotic allure of its lyrics. Goulding's comment that "the vocal control on this is no joke" is no exaggeration. The stripped-back arrangement leaves nowhere to hide, demanding precision and stamina.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

Where the original version of "Hypnotized" thrives on rave-ready intensity, this acoustic take feels like the morning after—a moment of reflection when the euphoria has worn off. It's a testament to Goulding's artistry that she can command attention with just her voice and a piano, proving that sometimes, less truly is more.

Watch Goulding perform the cover live below. You can read more about "Hypnotized" and listen here.
